Amerika Serikat Gelar Indo-Pacific Business Forum di Thailand
04 Nov 2019, 00:51 by Fajar Pebrianto, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Bangkok - United States Trade and Development Agency (USTDA), sebuah lembaga independen di bawah Pemerintah Amerika Serikat, hari ini, Senin, 4 November 2019, mengadakan Indo-Pacific Business Forum di Bangkok, Thailand. Forum yang bakal dihadiri pengusaha dan perwakilan pemerintah negara Asia Pasifik ini rencananya akan dihadiri Menteri Perdagangan Amerika Serikat, Wilbur Ross.
Forum ini bersifat inklusif dan berupaya mempromosikan perdagangan, investasi, dan kerja sama ekonomi di seluruh kawasan tersebut. Forum in juga mencoba menawarkan peluang jejaring baru kepada berbagai pihak. Mulai dari sektor privat, pengembang proyek, dan sumber dari pembiayaan.
"Pemerintahan Trump bekerja sama dengan mitra kami di seluruh Indo-Pasifik untuk membangun hubungan yang lebih baik, lebih adil, dan lebih sejalan," kata Ross dalam keterangan resmi panitia Indo-Pacific Business Forum di Bangkok, Thailand, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Ross mengatakan, Indo-Pacific juga menjadi kunci bagi pemerintah Amerika Serikat dalam memperluas perannya, sebagai salah satu mitra dagang dari negara-negara di kawasan tersebut. Forum ini, kata dia, tidak sekedar hanya akan mendatangkan pengusaha dan CEO sejumlah perusahaan, tapi juga membawa peluang untuk pertumbuhan. "Juga memberikan kesempatan bagi negara-negara untuk mengakses sumber investasi, di masa depan" kata dia.
Selain USTDA, ajang ini juga melibatkan kamar dagang kedua negara, yaitu U.S. Chamber of Commerce dan Thailan Chamber of Commerce. Acara ini juga diselenggarakan di tengah berlangsungnya gelaran East Asia-Summit di Bangkok. Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi hadir dalam ajang tersebut.
Selain Ross, acara ini juga akan dihadiri oleh Deputi Perdana Menteri dan Menteri Perdagangan Thailand, Jarin Lakanawisit. Lalu, sejumlah pengusaha juga hadir seperti Charles Freeman, Senior Vice President for Asia, U.S. Chamber of Commerce; Nigel Hearne, President of Asia Pacific, Chevron Asia Pacific Exploration & Production; and Tadashi Maeda, Governer of Japan Bank for International Cooperation (JBIC).

FAJAR PEBRIANTO

United States Holds Indo-Pacific Business Forum in Thailand
04 Nov 2019, 00:51 by Fajar Pebrianto, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Bangkok - The United States Trade and Development Agency (USTDA), an independent agency under the United States Government, today, Monday, November 4, 2019, held the Indo-Pacific Business Forum in Bangkok, Thailand. The forum which will be attended by entrepreneurs and representatives of the governments of the Asia Pacific countries is planned to be attended by the United States Minister of Commerce, Wilbur Ross.
This forum is inclusive and seeks to promote trade, investment and economic cooperation throughout the region. This forum also tries to offer new networking opportunities to various parties. Starting from the private sector, project developers, and sources of financing.
"The Trump administration is working with our partners throughout the Indo-Pacific to build better, fairer and more aligned relations," Ross said in an official statement at the Indo-Pacific Business Forum committee in Bangkok, Thailand, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Ross said, Indo-Pacific is also a key for the United States government in expanding its role, as one of the trading partners of countries in the region. This forum, he said, will not only bring entrepreneurs and CEOs to a number of companies, but also bring opportunities for growth. "It also provides opportunities for countries to access investment sources, in the future," he said.
In addition to USTDA, this event also involves the chambers of commerce of the two countries, namely U.S. Chamber of Commerce and Thailand Chamber of Commerce. This event was also held in the middle of the East Asia-Summit event in Bangkok. President Joko Widodo or Jokowi attended the event.
Besides Ross, this event will also be attended by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Commerce of Thailand, Jarin Lakanawisit. Then, a number of businessmen were also present such as Charles Freeman, Senior Vice President for Asia, U.S. Chamber of Commerce; Nigel Hearne, President of Asia Pacific, Chevron Asia Pacific Exploration & Production; and Tadashi Maeda, Governer of Japan Bank for International Cooperation (JBIC).
